text: This product helps with symptoms. Not 100%, but it does make a big difference.  Much, much better than other supplements I have tried e.g. black cohosh, chasteberry, dong quai, sage, soy, bioidentical progsterone. These other supplements have absolutely no positive effect. I checked with my naturopath, and she says that this Pacific Herbs formula works very well for some women. On the other hand, black cohosh, chasteberry, etc. work incredibly well for other women. You have to experiment to see which one works for you.This price is relatively high, I've seen it for between 40-55 dollars here on amazon.  I try to buy multiple bags when the price goes down. You have to order quickly since the price can easily go back up an hour afterward.I find this does not taste great as a tea, so I use the scoop to pour a dry dose in my mouth and then swallow with water. I don't mind the taste at all when the product is not in tea form, it has an herbal licorice flavor.-----------------Update: I was still taking this,, but I am so tired of paying 60 dollars a month ($720 per year). This is just too much to keep paying. I have recently started doing a castor oil pack every night and that takes away my hot flashes. Buying the castor oil is much cheaper than this formula, and it has additional benefits.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2015
name: Natural Sleep Supplement Herb Extract
features: iSleep Herb Pack contains 50 grams or 1.75 oz of concentrated herbal extract in granules and is based on a time-tested formulation that was originally written down over 800 years ago. iSleep only contains pure, potent herbs grown in nature.

iSleep works by gently relaxing your body and calming your active mind so you can fall asleep naturally, stay in deep, restful sleep and wake up alert without morning grogginess and other side-effects; also, there’s no risk of addiction with iSleep.

Take iSleep before bed if you have difficulty falling asleep or in the middle of night if you have trouble staying asleep. Dissolve .5 to 1.5 tsp of granules in warm water & drink like a tea or place directly on tongue & swallow with water or juice.

Many studies have shown that Chinese herbs can effectively manage sleeplessness, including an extensive one in Taiwan w/ over 16,000 participants, who had issues falling & staying asleep; Chinese herbs are time-tested & extensively clinically tested.

Pacific Herbs does NOT buy products that have been fumigated with sulfur dioxide (SD); we have stringent policies for raw herb sourcing of all our products, which are tested for potency & purity and traceable by LOT numbers on every package.

text: If I could give this product a thousand stars, I would. I am now 44 and have suffered my entire life with DEBILITATING menstrual pain to the point of ending up in the ER SEVERAL times. About ten years ago, I was diagnosed with PCOS. It has been suggested, but never confirmed I also have endometriosis. I am very healthy otherwise, and have been vegan for 20 years as well as grain-free. Still, nothing has helped the extreme pain I've had to experience since I began menstruating some 30 years ago. Acupuncture took the edge off and I do recommend it, but the pain was still there. Motrin helped a little too, but made me experience abdominal pain (even though I only took one every 12 hours). And I really am not a fan of Western Medicine, except for emergency/trauma stuff. I have very short periods only lasting two days, but so much pain. Anyway, long story short. I was in my local health food store and asked (yet again) if they could recommend anything for SEVERE menstrual pain. They showed me this, and I bought. This is now my second cycle using this product, and my pain (normally a 10 plus) is about a 2, occasionally goes to a 4, but still manageable (without having to put crap [Motrin] in my body). MAJOR relief. I wish I'd known about this product YEARS ago. THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!!! I will continue to use this so long as I have a period.

text: I never review books but this book is so amazing I want everyone to know about it. And I want other authors to see how incredible it is! Why can’t all guidebooks look like this? name: Medicinal Plants of the Pacific Northwest: A Visual Guide to Harvesting and Healing with 35 Common Species
brand: Medicinal Plants of the Pacific Northwest: A Visual Guide to Harvesting and Healing with 35 Common Species

text: This book covers medicinal plants native to the Pacific Northwest. It starts out with a bit of pertinent information about foraging safety and best practices, and mixes in some of the author’s personal spiritual relationship with the plants. I have to admit I wasn’t expecting there to be a spiritual element to this book, but it doesn’t negatively impact the ability to use this book as a reference. This book also describes the various ways you can prepare your foraged medicinal plants for use. This section is particularly informative.After all of the pertinent foraging information is imparted, the book gets straight to the 120 wild plants, which are listed alphabetically. Each plant gets a breakdown including its common name, its scientific name, any other names it might be called, and what the plant is used for. Each plant also gets at least one picture. You learn how to identify your plant. You learn where/when/how to harvest it. You’re taught what each plant is used for, how to ensure a future harvest, and you even get a breakdown of how best to prepare your plant for its medicinal purposes. Do you use your cottonwood buds for a tincture? Do you use them for a salve? This book will tell you.The back of the book features a handy metric conversion chart, a list of references, and a helpful index that allows you to look up individual plants by name or by the ailment you’re hoping to relieve.It’s a data-packed book laid out in a fairly straightforward and thoughtful manner. Those curious about herbalism, foraging, or just native plants in the Pacific Northwest would really enjoy this. And for those not interested in the spiritual aspects discussed in this book, don’t worry. The author’s spirituality does not permeate the book in a way that negatively impacts its usefulness for plant reference.
title: A useful reference book with some unexpected spiritual beliefs included

text: I just LOVE the way this book was written and the way the author conveys his kinship to the plant kingdom.  His introduction and explanation of how he got interested in the subject, and his description of his many years of working with medicinal herbs and wildcrafting, is reminicsent of own interest and enthusiasm. text: One of the things I appreciated about this book is that it provides an excellent overview of the topic for newbies, but also has enough depth for those who have some experience wildcrafting and working with medicinal plants. I enjoyed reading about best practices, safety, which plants you'll find each season, and how to harvest different parts.Chapter 4: Medicinal Plant Identification Guide, was my favorite part of the book because this can definitely feel overwhelming to someone just starting out. The info on botany/plant morphology was clear, useful and had just the right amount of detail to feel more comfortable with the terminology when learning to identify plants.The last section has a nice intro to some of the medicinal plants native to the Pacific NW, which can then be cross referenced in a field guide when hiking or exploring your neighborhood. A great book to learn about the many benefits of working with these amazing plants!
title: A great introduction to wild medicinal plants in the Pacific NW
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2022
name: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants
brand: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants

text: General interest in wildcrafting and herbalism has dramatically grown in recent years, and in response so has the appearance of publications and education programs designed to satisfy the demands of those seeking to become more knowledgeable and to develop their skills in the field. Beginning this journey of learning can be overwhelming without solid resources. This self-published introductory guide to wildcrafting, herbalism, and medicinal plants of the Pacific Northwest is one of the more recent books to become available.The author endeavors to cover a broad foundation of concepts for those beginning to learn, including ethical harvesting, plant identification (including poisonous species), basic plant uses in herbalism, an overview of the history of herbalism and plant medicine, and highlighting a basic inventory of common plants that can be found in the Pacific Northwest. It should be noted that a number of the plants showcased in this book can also be found widely throughout North America.As a reviewer, my opinion is that this book is a good starting point for those who are unfamiliar with herbalism and field botany, however for gaining requisite skills and knowledge there is no substitute for spending time out in the field with an experienced botanist and/or herbalist. Learning plant identification is a life-long art, as is developing deep relationships with individual medicinal plants. This book would be a starting point for someone seeking to begin their plant journey.
title: Introductory guide for wildcrafting and PNW plants

brand: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants

text: Love this book!  As new home/property owners we are trying to replant native trees, shrubs, and plants to bring a long ago clear-cut and bulldozed area back to life.  Learning about plants and herbs native to our area that we can incorporate into our Hedgerow and garden areas, AND also use medicinally, is very exciting.  The information and instruction given in this book will definitely be referred to often for years to come.
title: Wonderful resource!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2022
name: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants
brand: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants

text: This book does a good job of detailing how and when to ethically harvest medicinal plants, and how to preserve and prepare them. It also describes 47 medicinal plants found in the PNW. Line drawings and written descriptions are provided for each species, as well as some basic botany to help in plant identification. Strangely the drawing for Thimbleberry appears to be a drawing of Trailing Blackberry, having the compound leaves with three leaflets of this related species rather than the simple five-lobed leaves of Thimbleberry. Overall the drawings do roughly emulate their subjects though. As a botanist I would be wary of beginners using these resources alone to identify plants for medicinal use, but in combination with a good field guide or two the resources provided would be useful.In terms of readability I found Boyle's prose to be a bit awkward at times. There doesn't appear to be an editor for the book, which does it a disservice. Nonetheless, the author's knowledge of and passion for herbology and wildcrafting make this book informative and engaging. I particularly appreciate his emphasis on ethical harvesting, and the gratitude and joy to be had from engaging directly with wild plants.

name: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants
brand: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants

text: There was a great deal in here about wildcrafting/wild herb harvesting that I have not read before. The author repeated safety warnings many times - which is good, considering how easy it can be to have a reaction to a plant or accidentally find a poisonous look-alike. There were times I found the writing a bit confusing or odd, but it didn't effect my overall reading enjoyment. The line drawings were interesting,  but I agree with another reviewer that having another resource to verify plants against would be a good thing,  because personally, I would rather have a color photo to compare the plant to than just a line drawing - it would help me feel more confident in my identification. Also, this book isn't about PNW native plants,  although it does mention some of them,  it is about medicinal plants (some of which are considered invasive in Washington state - like Herb Robert) that grow in the PNW, and I have to admit I was hoping there would be info on more of the truly native plants.
title: Enthusiastic guide to herbal wildcrafting in the PNW
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2022
name: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants
brand: Pacific Northwest Medicinal Plants and Herbs for Beginners: The Complete Guide to Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Medicinal Plants

text: Sharing wildcrafting practices with beginners presents challenges well met by Rory Boyle. In addition to succinctly presenting safety info, such as the three most deadly plants (baneberry, poison hemlock, and water hemlock), he presents an ethos that is sustaining and helpful to habitat through nuanced gathering practices. For example, dandelion is so hearty you can feel free to harvest as much as you want, while endangered plants are off limits. Rory points to the needs for learning wild medicines as a form of reconnecting, healing ourselves as following our natural instinct. Enjoy taking this path, rewilding way of being!

text:
I can't quit reading and rereading this book. A native Oregonian, I had no idea some of the so-called "weeds" on my property were not only edible, but also medicinal! This book has changed my way of looking at the plants I once ignored. I've tried several of the teas and concoctions. Great instructions! Inspiring. Easy to read -- I feel like the author's my new best friend.
  
Medicinal Plants of the Pacific West
title: Inspiring, Local and Useful
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2017
name: Medicinal Plants of the Pacific West
brand: Medicinal Plants of the Pacific West

text: A thorough monograph of each species features complete descriptions for identification and collection, medicinal uses and preparation.  Range maps aid in understanding general locales, drawings are accurate and useful, text is based on a sound grasp of cell chemistry without overdoing the technicalities, and is relatively myth-dispelling.  Responsible and authoritative from a practical intimacy, this hands-on guide also provides a glossary and cross-references.  A valuable addition to the herbals shelf, it would be nice to see this volume as a spiral-bound guide for field use.  The best yet of Moore's well-devoted works in my library.
title: Insightful and accurate

text: This is essential reading and reference for herbalists on the US west coast. I'm especially appreciative of the alcohol intermediary oil extraction method on page 25. It makes the most fragrant and deeply colored oils  (only good for certain herbs) in just 24 hours.

text: I  have been looking for books on how to make medicines and identify plants. This book has been very helpful and I plan on buying more of his books. The book is well organized has some color pictures, location maps, line drawings, information on plant appearance, habitat, constituents, collecting and preparation, stability, medicinal uses and contraindications. It has a supplemental herb list, a theraputic use list, glossary and index of plant names.The only thing I do not like and it is not just with this book but with almost all of the plant idenification books, is that they do not have color pictures for all of the plants.They need that and when they do pictures they need the photos of all the plant parts. Many times drawings are just not good enough especially if you are new to this. The only reason for the four stars is the lack of color pictures.

text: I am a beginner to foraging and after going through this book I couldn't be more excited to get out on a hike and try and identify some plants! I love in Colorado so this guide is perfect for me and since I love camping and hiking I'll definitely be carrying it around all the time! This guide provides you with EVERYTHING you need to know from the description of each plant to the habitat they grow in to the different edible and medicinal uses some of them may offer. One thing in particular I really enjoyed was there was a whole section going over toxic plants to be cautious of. I think this will be extremely useful for me when I'm exploring outside. I have the kindle version but I just ordered a paper back too!!!!! You definitely NEED this if your considering foraging for plant or if you already do this extensive guide will have you covered!!!
title: The perfect guide for a beginner to foraging!!

text: I found this book very helpful as I am a beginner and I want to learn all I can before starting.  This book goes over everything from the tools that are helpful to toxic plants.  There are black and white pics of each plant and a detailed written description of each.  It goes over each plant and its medicinal and edible qualities.  I would take off half a star for spaces between each word is missing in alot of places but I was still able to read it pretty smoothly.  Also it would be great if the pics were in color, however with Google this isn't absolutely necessary.  All in all its a wonderful book to add to your collection of you're just now beginning to be interested in foraging plants!

text: This is the first time I am consuming this product. After watching a few YouTube videos, I decided to make a gel to be used in smoothies. Based on the color of this moss, it seems to be good quality. A very little (like 1/5th of this bag) makes a whole blender full of gel. You have to wash this very thoroughly. There was not much sand in it but there were some other type of algae attached to it (in tiny amounts, but needed to be cleaned). It is easier to clean them after soaking the moss for a while. So, I washed it and then put in water with some lemon juice for about 4-5 hours (unlike 12 hours to overnight as recommended on the listing). Though it has tones of yellow and red in dry form, most of it is gone after the wash and it turns into a pinkish white noodle-like form. There were some thick and hard parts and some soft parts. The latter more quickly softens and the hard pieces become like soft leather, but this doesn’t seem to matter. After putting the whole thing with some soak water in the blender, I got a pretty smooth and thick juice. I took a spoonful and I had no difficulty swallowing it. The gel has no smell or flavor to it. So, consider this as a neutral ingredient in whatever you are planning to make. This is just not your salad type algae, but it is pretty good for its suggested uses.

text: The Homesteaders Herbal Handbook: 5 Simple Steps to Grow, Harvest, and Store 25 Backyard Medicinal Herbs to Craft Your Own Natural Remedies by Jenni Rempel is a very informative book that will delight even the staunchest of city folk.  Whether you have a lot of land or just a windowsill, with this book, you can help your own health and let's be honest, given the rising cost of modern pharmaceuticals, your wallet as well.  Ms. Rempel does include the reminder to check with your doctor before beginning this medicinal pursuit to help ensure your safety.  Various links are included to help expand your knowledge beyond the borders of this book. Modern medicine is still in its infancy compared to older established cultural practices such as Western Use, Ayurveda Medicine and Traditional Chinese Medicine and all three of the established practices have used herbs in the treatment of others for thousands of years and therefore, the benefits of the herbs should not be overlooked and if you're still doubting that, consider the fact that even the Father of Medicine himself, Hippocrates used these herbs and had listed 400 herbs for their medicinal properties in 5th century BC.Many of the herbs listed are ones that most people should be familiar with: Aloe Vera, Chamomile, Chili Pepper, Elderberry, Garlic, Ginger, Ginkgo, Lavender, Mint, Oregano, Parsley, Rosemary, Sage, St. John's Wort, Thyme and Turmeric. The others are Ashwagandha, Calendula, Echinacea, Hawthorn, Holy Basil, Hyssop, Milk Thistle, Moringa, and Valerian. Covered subjects with each of these herbs is planting, the needs of the individual herb, how to harvest it, the best way to store them and what you can do with each herb after it's been harvested plus potential side effects, correct dosage, the traditional and modern benefits, possible interactions with other medicines, and who shouldn't use it as an herbal medicine.The one section that stood out to me not just because it's always a good idea to have alternatives to how you take any medicine, be it traditional or modern, but because after reading through it, I ended up making a lot of these or at least those that I had the ingredients for was titled: “Putting those homestead herbs to good use with 16 simple recipes”. These recipes range from curry to whiskey and while not quite everything in between, you'll be hard pressed not to find at least one that you'll want to devour out of these mouthwatering recipes.
title: Medicinal herbs made easy
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2022
name: The Homesteader Herbal Handbook: 5 Simple Steps to Grow, Harvest, and Store 25 Backyard Medicinal Herbs to Craft Your Own Natural Remedies (Growing Natural Remedies Series)
brand: The Homesteader Herbal Handbook: 5 Simple Steps to Grow, Harvest, and Store 25 Backyard Medicinal Herbs to Craft Your Own Natural Remedies (Growing Natural Remedies Series)

text: I received the advanced copy link for the PDF version of this book about 2-3 weeks ago. I am an herbalism student, so I thought it would be helpful to tack this on for learning. It was quite helpful, as I did not inherit the gardening skills of my parents & grandparents. There are some nice tips in this book that I think will help out when I start to construct my pollinator, herbal/plant medicine, & vegetable garden out back. I've been actively trying to become a better DIY person for years. Just this year I dove in & started learning more with some local & online folks to forage, wildcraft, & homestead. This advanced copy was a great addition to my list of resources. There are some things I knew beforehand, as I've really only DIY'd with essential oils. Some recipes are very similar to what I've been doing for years. There are things I didn't know or hear about before. I'm hoping I can order a physical book, as the PDF version was a little hard to read with my eye issues. Sending it to my kindle finally worked. But the best viewing for this advanced PDF copy was the kindle app on my tablet. I've found out that PDFs show up differently & one doesn't have all the highlighting & note-taking capabilities compared to a digital book. I'm still one of those that cling to physical books, especially those for reference. This will be added to my physical library when I can afford it. I have enjoyed Jenni's emails & other sources of information since being introduced to her & her knowledge a few weeks ago. I'd definitely recommend it to a beginner. It appears to be laid out understandably. At least for me, who processes things a bit differently & might need a different way of learning than some other folks. I wouldn't call myself a beginner. Maybe more middle-of-the-road for some aspects, maybe an expert in others. But definitely a beginner as far as foraging, wildcrafting, & 90% of homesteading go.
title: Great for a beginner! Or anyone else on their homesteading journey.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
name: The Homesteader Herbal Handbook: 5 Simple Steps to Grow, Harvest, and Store 25 Backyard Medicinal Herbs to Craft Your Own Natural Remedies (Growing Natural Remedies Series)
brand: The Homesteader Herbal Handbook: 5 Simple Steps to Grow, Harvest, and Store 25 Backyard Medicinal Herbs to Craft Your Own Natural Remedies (Growing Natural Remedies Series)

text: Before reading "The Homesteader Herbal Handbook," I had zero knowledge about herbs. To be honest, I only use pepper on my mashed potatoes and crushed red peppers on my pizza. Beyond that, I have never used anything else. Jenni Rempel, the author, does an excellent job of making the book easily digestible. It doesn't feel like you are reading a book at all. Instead, it feels like you are sitting down at a table, drinking coffee and talking about herbs and the benefits they can do for you, and how easy it can be to set up something to maximize the growth of these herbs. The book's format is easy to understand and comprehend from the front to the back, which optimizes the reading experience. It is a handbook. It'll serve beginners well and perhaps even keep seasoned pros on their toes. This book is very informational.Aside from the information, what this book does well, in the beginning, is it'll make you think. At the beginning of the book, the author dives into a few mysteries and the history of herbs. She attempts to answer the question 'can science and nature work together?', while "herbs have an incredible history but lack the volume of scientific studies to prove their benefits. Pharmaceuticals are still in their infancy compared with traditional medicine" (pg 19 of 166). I admire the attempt to wrestle with the question and give the best answer that can be given, the answer is both, and they need to work together in unity. The book is definitely worth the read.
title: Must read, loads of information in an easily digestible way.

text: The Homesteader Herbal Handbook is an essential guidebook to any greenthumbs trying to expand their backyard gardening or take it to the next level. The author, Jenni Rempel, has taken what can be a frustrating topic into an easy going, five step approach, filled with dos and don'ts, helpful tips on how to be successful.The book is an incredible resource, not just for outdoor plants but ones you can grow indoors. I was fascinated by the aloe vera chapter and will probably start growing my own in a windowsill. As it turns out, natural aloe vera is not green!! It is something companies add to their product in an effort to make it look more how we think natural aloe vera would look like.I love the homesteader approach to life. It is this rough enthusiasm for trying your best that appeals to me. I do backyard gardening and did not realize how much more I expand with different herbs that I had overlooked. Jenni really is through throughout her book on tips to help the plants live, what to expect along the way, what they can used for with natural or herbal medicine and what the science says on each. She strikes a good balance of, it is a good add on, not a replacement for modern medicine.I highly recommend this book to anyone who does backyard gardening, raised garden beds, has plants around the house or anyone who just wants to save a little money by growing something themselves.
title: Insightful for those interested in gardening !

text: The Homesteader Herbal Handbook by Jenni Rempel is a wonderful book containing great information about herbs.The book starts out with the history of herbs.  There's details about the uses of herbs throughout history and so much more.  It was interesting too read the section about before pharmaceuticals, how our ancestors survived using plants, herbs, and spices.  They had to go by trial and error.  That was interesting to read.This book is full of useful and helpful information about herbs.  There were several herbs listed.  Many I had not heard of.  I like that the author listed some uses for each herb for example what the herb is used for, like anti-inflammatory or heartburn.The author includes information such as details about harvesting the herbs and how to make the most out of it.  That was really nice to read about.Some of the herbs listed are Aloe Vera, Elderberry, Ginger, Lavender, Mint, Hyssop, Rosemary, Sage, Turmeric,  Calendula, Garlic, and more.It is very interesting to learn information about different herbs and the uses for them.  The information is very helpful and useful.  I personally really like using herbs instead of regular medicine so it was really neat to learn about some new herbs.The information in this book is wonderful and very useful.  I really enjoyed it and highly recommend it.

text: I LOVE fresh herbs but have not yet had any luck growing my own. We will not talk about the Chia Herb Garden fiasco of 2006. EVER. My family always had fresh mint and aloe when I was growing up and were frequently used for their healing properties. Aloe was for burns, mostly sunburns thanks to my Irish ancestors. Mint was excellent for making tea for an upset stomach. Reading 5 Simple Steps helped calm (some of) my black thumb nightmares, giving me a smidge of confidence to try growing my own aloe and mint. Maybe I'll add garlic and ginger since I use them so often while cooking.

text: So its my first ever review on amazon. I am not a fan of writing reviews but i just need to tell you guys about this tea. As u can see on the pic - this is what i received! I paid for a medium size tea for sleep . And they sent me a cute letter with my name saying that they multiplied my tea in size and also gifted me a small bag of peppermint tea on top of that. Also they included couple of beautiful post cards. I felt so appreciated as a customer! Not saying that the tea itself smells as a fresh fields of mountain area… it made me sleep as a baby in just 5 mins! I am struggling with a severe anxiety and ptsd. So when i am saying “sleep like a baby”- it means a world to me. I was having serious issues with my sleep ,nightmares and insomnia… and this herbs made me have a wonderful restful night! My husband also took a cup of this blend and was sleeping amazing as well. It tastes very very pleasant!So if u struggle with a healthy sleep or anxiety or any hard period of life when your nerves need a support - try this.Again- i am amazed !! And the customer appreciation is beyond perfect!

text: I love this loose tea! Not only do you get a huge bag of tea, but it is wonderful, strong, and fresh-tasting. I use one tablespoon for 32 oz of water, and I love how refreshing it is. I use my large glass Pyrex measuring cup with a little fine mesh strainer to make enough for myself and my wife.It has become our nightly ritual, replacing alcohol after a long day. Feel better and far less expensive than bourbon!

Non-Irradiated
Frontier is a member owned Co-op, responsible to people and planet
brand: Frontier Co-op

text: I wish this bag had a way to be resealed after opening. But it doesn't. I have to use a rubber band around it to try to keep it closed. It's odd that something like herbal tea leaves would not come in a closable container.Other than the inconvenience of that, this big ol' bag of organic peppermint leaves smells pretty amazing and tastes great. As soon as you open the bag, the strong minty, menthol aroma fills your nasal passageways and actually helps to clear them.It's potent, and the taste is surprisingly refreshing. At least it was surprising to me... I'm not used to drinking minty teas, and this one makes a delicious, bold tea with a slight tinge of sweetness and grassiness. You can smell that in there. It's more complex in aroma than one miggt expect.I like to mix it with organic raspberry leaves, organic elderberries & organic calendula flowers. But it really adds a perfect touch to herbal teas that are lacking in that little something, lacking in taste, in that pizzazz.Peppermint tea gives you a very cool and refreshing feeling, making it perfect for summer get-togethers, it gives you energy, and helps ease feelings of nausea. It's also known to give you mental alertness and clarity. This stuff is pretty powerful but not overwhelming in any way.If infused, the peppermint extract can be applied to sore muscles for some relief. You can blend with Arnica montana, Comfrey & Calendula as well, which are great for conditioning skin, healing bruises, and relieving soreness, stiffness and pain.I'm pleasantly pleased with this large bag of organic peppermint leaves, and I have so many plans for it! It really does inspire great ideas, and I decided to get the Spearmint leaves from Frontier as well. I promise to let you know how that goes!

text: I previously bought 1 lb bags of peppermint and spearmint tea from Davidson's and U.S. Wellness. Although they have a strong scent in the bag, the had almost no flavor, and definitely no flavor that I could identify as mint. The Davidson's spearmint was so powdery that it leaked out of the tea ball. This Frontier Co-Op bulk peppermint tea is an improvement on both fronts. First, the leaves are cut to the right size and don't leak out of the tea ball. Second, it has a strong minty smell and actually tastes like peppermint. I don't use any type of sweetener, which limits the taste. That's why I only give it 4 stars overall. With some sugar, it should be a great tea. Davidson's peppermint tea has gone up to almost $23 for 16 oz. Frontier Co-Op is $16 as of this writing. It's a no-brainer at that price difference. Note that I previously bought Davidson's spearmint, not peppermint, but based on the price I would not opt for Davidson's peppermint either.

features: Grow Your Own Natural Remedies - This herbal seed vault provides 36 packets of seeds for planting a medicinal herb garden outdoors. This variety kit contains annual, biennial, and perennial herbs and flowers that are known for their medicinal benefits and healing properties. Occasional substitutions with appropriate replacements may occur due to shortages.

Medicinal Herb Starter Pack - From leaf to flower to root, the different parts of these plants can be used in many different ways. Create your own mixed tea from dried or fresh herbs. Use the raw ingredients to extract your own essential oil and create herbal tinctures, infusions, salves, lotions, balms, and ointments.

Sustainable Living - This essential seed collection is a must-have for any homesteader, prepper, naturalist, or survivalist who wants to become more self-reliant! This home apothecary in a bag gives you control, letting you grow an organic, wholesome garden to create your herbal treatments the right way. Many of these plants are ideal for container gardening, in hydroponic systems or growing indoors.

Easy to Grow - The seeds are packed in a beautiful paper packet with instructions for successful growing and germination in your home garden. Each package also has instructions for saving seeds after harvest. Getting started is simple for both beginner and experienced gardeners.

Quality Seeds - Plant now or store for future growing seasons. These seeds will remain viable for years if stored in a cool dry location. Our safe, non-hybrid non-GMO heirloom seeds are always open-pollinated, untreated, and selected to ensure the best germination rates.

text: This is a simply marvelous book. It is a mystery to me why it is not continuously in print. Do not hesitate to buy this used from Amazon Marketplace sellers, as I did.The book is large and beautifully fashioned and produced, with gorgeous full-color photographs not only of each herb, but of dozens of different species of each herb, and of every possible use to which herbs can be put. There are full-color pictures of crafts, teas, household items, massage how-to illustrations, dyes--to say nothing of prepared food dishes; this is actually a cookbook within an herbal!ONE CAVEAT: if you are looking for an in-depth gardening how-to, with exhaustive planting info, you might want a supplement for this book, which sticks to the basics. But every other herb-related topic is embellished and elaborated on. There are dozens of pages with full-color, labeled illustrations of different "theme" gardens you can plan. Whole chapters EACH on potpurri, herbal cosmetics, dyes, medicines, and household cleaners. Fabulous, unique homemade gift items like herbal-scented beads--that's right, painted beads made entirely out of herbs and plants!The food/cooking section alone is worth the price of the book. The dishes are fantastic. I have already made the Sweet Rosemary Slices and several teas and drinks, and they are wonderful. Almost every recipe has a full-color photo.I could go on and on, but rather than waste your time, I will leave you to hit "Add To Shopping Cart."Money has rarely been this well-spent.

text:
This is an excellent book, but there are a couple of drawbacks. First, and most annoying, is the ordering of the herbs by scientific name. Makes it hard to find the herb you're looking for. Second, it's a large book, takes up a lot of space on the table and doesn't fit on all shelves.It has served me well enough, but I recently came across
  
Your Backyard Herb Garden: A Gardener's Guide to Growing Over 50 Herbs Plus How to Use Them in Cooking, Crafts, Companion Planting and More







  
  
    and I have to say this is the book I would pick up instead, in retrospect. I may even buy it anyway. It's small, has all the reference information in this one (and then some), and more readily available.

text: Bought this book used.  It was in great shape.  I don't remember seller mentioning that there was writing in the book although I found this to be a nice surprise.  There isn't much and it's not blocking anything.  I found it charming.  The book itself has some nice designs for herb gardens.  There are beautiful live pictures of the plants including the roots, seeds flowers and leaves.  Some have pictures of the seeds and leaves when dried.  Each plant has a little history and description.  Book gives lifespan (example Hardy Shrub), and height.  It also sections on Cultivation; propagating, growing, harvesting, and preserving, Uses; Culinary, Cosmetic, Aromatic, and Medicinal.  The book is a bit larger than I expected so it's not one you could carry easily as it's about 14 inches by 8 inches.  These are guestimates.  :)  I am very happy with the book and look forward to using it for many years.

text: This book has so much information, I couldn't imagine not having it.  Each page or set of pages (depending on how much information) covers an herb or plant or flower, and it goes over myth and folklore of the plant, name meanings and origins, and varieties of the plant, as well as a sidebar that has the cultivation information (soil, sun exposure, growing tips and guides, harvesting and preserving) as well as possible uses (decorative, culinary, household, aromatic, medicinal, and cosmetic).On top of this, there's sections where the author goes in depth for planning an herb garden, basic all purpose small and large herb garden layouts and plants contained, patio, balcony, and indoor herb gardens, theme and aromatic gardens, the list goes on, with another ten or more.  Also included are smaller herb guides (herbs for flowers and foliage, salad herbs, herbal trees, etc), a guide to herbal decorations such as wreaths and hangings, garlands, herbal baskets and the like, herbs within the kitchen (soups, fish, meat, etc - just about anything you'd like to cook), herbs for the household (household products, dyes, papers, toys and trinkets, potpourri, etc), herbs for beauty, essential oils, herbs for health, cultivating and harvesting herbs...  Literally, there is so much information to be listed that I cannot summarize it all here.I find that this is definitely an indispensable volume, and it shows - my book has dozens of stickies in the tops of the pages, to mark everything I might want quick reference to (which, actually, doesn't work as well as I thought, since I have 7 levels of stickies...).The only drawback I can think of with this book is that it is not alphabetized in any way.  It makes it a bit of a pain to start, but the index does have an accurate guide (though it's in scientific names, not common ones).  I find, though, that this issue is easily overlooked, though, as this book is chalk full of information, and a book I won't easily get rid of!

text: This is a really great book about herbs.  About half of the book is an "herb index" with colored pictures and detailed information about various herbs.  This book focuses a lot on how to use herbs in everyday life.  There are tons of recipes, some for more common uses, like herbal soups and breads.  But there is a lot of information on less-common ways of utilizing herbs, like making herbal dyes, paper, potpourri, facial creams, and essential oils.  I haven't tried all of the recipes, so I cannot say for certain that they are all fabulous, but there is definitely plenty of information.This book has a 1988 copyright, and it does give off a little bit of an 80's vibe, but herbs haven't changed much in the last few decades, and the majority of the information is still useful.  While this book doesn't devote a great deal of time to actually growing herbs, it's a good book for learning how to actually use them.

text: There are so many Herb books out their; if you could only get one this is it! I had seen this book at my Doctors office; in just the 10 minutes I was in the waiting room; I knew I had to have a copy! In this book there is anything from indoor/window/outdoor/patio/balcony herb gardens, Herbs in the Kitchen (With recipes included), Herbs for: dyes, toys, and potpourri. Herb for Beauty: skin care, skin cream/lotion recipes, herbal baths, soaps, hand, hair, eye, teeth care. Herbs for health: preparations, A-Z herb treatments. Cultivating & Harvesting: soil prep, propagation, maintaining plant shape. Growing herbs: in Container/ indoors. How to keeping herb plants healthy, Harvesting, and store/preserving them. (and much more!)Note: I have seen this book with a different cover picture; but everything is the same inside the book. I was able to get a hardcover copy in Good condition for under $7 (free shipping) so look around for the deals (for some reason the paper back copy was listed as $8 bucks more; strange right?) you won't be disappointed in this book!!! If I could give is 6 stars I would have!

text: Easy to read book, logically structured. At the risk of repeating myself, the author has taken the gamble of using step-by-step instructions for each plant to make reading and applying techniques simple. For example, we find a straightforward structure of the chapters that deal with planting: planting guide, harvesting (if applicable), maintenance and care, and companion plants.We also found very interesting information about plants and gardening in the PNW, valuable insights about soil, tips, mistakes, management of pests and diseases, and many tips and tricks.As a newbie, some techniques could have been better illustrated and discussed. It is an excellent book for the initiated. Still, it remains challenging for beginners to apply.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2006
name: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
brand: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space

text: This book is not about Japanese gardens, whatever the title. I have read a lot of books about Japanese gardens but the content of this book is not in concordance with what other authors write about Japanese gardens.Foto 4-7 is referred to as a bright, flashy and colourfull Chinese-style gazebo in a cultivated Japanese garden. The foto though shows indeed a Chinese-style structure but the garden shows a two-tier fountain with a manneke-piss on top ....  in a Japanese garden?The foto's are nice but nowhere are there descriptions given of what it is or where it is.Then there are a lot of fotos of beautiful acers, but nowhere is there a connection to the text.And finally there are the drawings and the maps/designs. The drawings, to me, are basic but ok. The maps/designs are terrible: they are inconclusive and no time nor effort is put into it to make them at least look good or in any way professional.To me this book is an absolute waste of money.
title: Waste of money
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2009

brand: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space

Take a look at the index, look for the words "designing", "making", "creating", or "building".Coffee table book...get it.Sunset or Ortho type...don't.

text: This large and beautiful book is divided into three parts. The first is a basic introduction to herbs and spices including a brief historical view, fairly common information about growing and harvesting herbs. The second actually examines individual spices. There are photographs of the plant and the spice as well as a guide to how to use them. Recipes are interspersed throughout. The last section involves the art of blending spices. Featured a number of bends, rubs and mixes and additional recipes. I found the first part rather bland.  I liked the second part. The text is uncomplicated and I appreciated the culinary information and the sidebars with the suggested amounts to be used with different foods. The third section was my favorite with many interesting blends. Some of them require many ingredients which can become costly.  This book is well done and sure to delight the home cook and arm chair gourmet alike.
title: The Bold and the Beautiful
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2014

brand: The Spice and Herb Bible

features: GROUND GINGER ROOT - Frontier Co-op Ground Ginger Root (Zingiber officinale) is a rhizome, and has been an important spice for over 3,000 years. Ginger root is a staple in Asian and Indian cuisines, often used to give foods a spicy, aromatic flavor. Enjoyed in cuisines the world over for its warm, spicy-sweet aroma and flavor, ginger complements both sweet and savory dishes.

GROUND GINGER ROOT - Frontier Co-op Ground Ginger Root (Zingiber officinale) is a rhizome, and has been an important spice for over 3,000 years. Ginger root is a staple in Asian and Indian cuisines, often used to give foods a spicy, aromatic flavor. Enjoyed in cuisines the world over for its warm, spicy-sweet aroma and flavor, ginger complements both sweet and savory dishes.

VERSATILE USES - This lovely off-white to light brown spice is ground from the dried ginger root making it convenient for baked foods, curries and chutneys and for sprinkling on applesauce and other cooked fruit and vegetable dishes. Ginger also lends its hot, spicy flavor to condiments, relishes, sauces, stir-fries, pickles, beverages, candies and all types of desserts.

IMPORTED AND ORGANIC - Our ginger root is grown and processed in Peru, China, India, and Sri Lanka. There are no artificial additives or chemicals used at any stage of growing, harvesting and manufacturing.

RESEALABLE - Try the premium quality Frontier Co-op herbs and culinary seasonings in convenient, reclosable packaging. Our stand-up bags are made to keep our products as fresh on the last day as they are on the first. Just scoop and reseal to lock in the freshness. These bags are resealable, sturdy, and great for easy storage and easy access. For best results, store in a cool, dry place.

ABOUT US - Owned by stores and organizations that buy and sell our products, Frontier Co-op has been a member-owned cooperative since 1976. We support natural living and our products are never irradiated or treated with ETO (Ethylene Oxide). We’re committed to the health and welfare of the environment and everyone producing and consuming our botanical products.

text: I researched many different alternative ways to help a family member who was shockingly diagnosed with non-hodgkins lymphoma, a blood cancer. (I must say that the power of prayer is first and foremost in my books, but for those who are not religious, put that comment aside please and read on.)I wanted to find products that could help could help clean the blood and boost the body's immune system. I read great things about seaweed and how those exposed to radiation were using it to detox their blood. I also found that it is hard to get "pure" seaweed because much of it is contaminated in the ocean. I trusted this product's web site for the safety of this product and bought the Modifilan. It mentioned that is contains Fucoidan which causes certain types of rapidly growing cancer cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis (self-destruction of cancer cells), Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism.It is expensive, but completely worth it. After only several months of taking this daily along with these other products, which I will list below, the cancer disappeared. It was a truly miracle to all of us and the doctors could not explain it, but I believe that these products greatly helped along with a change in diet (eliminate sugar and eat veggies). The other products that were taken in combination with this were, listed from most important to least taken were: Essiac, IP-6, Source Naturals Immune Defense (mushrooms), liquid chlorophyll, Krill oil,  Purple Defense, Momordica extract, Curcumin. Yes, I know it's a lot and you can never know for sure which one helped the most, but maybe the combination of them all did. I just wanted to list them so that others who might be in a similar situation, who are looking for cancer fighting products, can easily see what may work for them.
title: Great for detox and those with illnesses, such as cancer...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2013
name: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS
description: The powers of seaweeds have been drawn upon for centuries for their ability to prolong life, prevent disease, impart beauty and health. Worldwide research is continuously being done and brown seaweed has been found to be the most beneficial type. This product, MODIFILAN, is the purest, most natural nutritional supplement made from the brown seaweed Laminaria Japonica. Extract contains the life essential properties of Organic Iodine, Alginates, Fucoidan and Laminarin. Worldwide scientific studies and clinical research of these elements showed: *Organic Iodine feeds the Thyroid Gland, which controls metabolism and promotes maturation of the nervous system. Iodine is important for thyroid disorders, wherever underactive or overactive. *Alginate is a natural absorbent of radioactive elements, heavy metals and free radicals. It has the unique ability of binding heavy metals and radioactive elements to its own molecules. As the Alginate cannot be broken down by the bile or saliva and cannot be absorbed by the body, it is secreted from the body together with the heavy metals and radioactive substances. *Fucoidan causes certain types of rapidly growing cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis, Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism. *Laminarin is a polysaccharide helpful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. It exhibits 30% of the anticoagulant activity of heparin. These elements, treasured in brown seaweeds, are enhanced by patented cold-temperature extraction technology, which does not break their molecular structure. And MODIFILAN is not just another dry seaweed product - it is highly concentrated product. FORTY pounds of raw seaweed is needed to make ONE pound of MODIFILAN.
features: Boosts the immune system.
Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium
Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract.
Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow.
Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
brand: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS

text: I have taken this off and on for years now. I was treated for Lyme disease late 2013 in Scottsdale.  Prior to going to AZ for treatment I had all of my mercury fillings removed and teeth fixed by an awesome dentist. I tested off the charts for both lead and mercury.  While undergoing IV treatment it included some chelation to lower my heavy metals.  By the end of my treatment I was tested again and they were lowered, but still higher than one wants. My Lyme doctor told me when I returned home to Texas I would need to continue chelation therapy. I bought an IV package, but it took 3 months before the home doctor re-tested me for heavy metals before we began chelation therapy.  During those 3 months I took 5-7 Modifilan daily just to help with my energy and I was low on iodine. Shockingly, when my chelation test came back after the 3 months of taking Modifilan my lead and mercury and other heavy metal levels were so low we did not have to do a single chelation treatment!!!  The 3 months of brown seaweed had pulled it out. I had read that it would, but did not know that it would do so efficiently! I always took it first thing in the morning on an empty stomach with a big glass of water due to the iodine. Side benefit it helped my BM's to be smoother and easier to pass.Update: June 8, 2018  I am still taking the Modifilian. When I run out I definitely  notice. Still love it. It still helps with my energy and I am assuming that it is still removing mercury. As your body detoxes heavy metals little by little more will dump from the cells. It is also still helping the bowels move normally.

text: I have been taking this product for only 1 week now but I absolutely feel wonderful. I work in a vitamin store so I have tried a lot of supplements for energy and whatnot but this is by far the best. I had a ct scan about 4 months ago and had a shot of the contrast fluid. I had a "slight" allergic reaction to it including itchy throat, redness on chest and shortness of breath. 4 months later, I'm still short of breath. To my knowledge, this is due to the radiated iodine shot they gave me. The radiologist and GI doc said I would excrete it in my urine but that is definitely false. The radiologist ever freaked out when she saw I had a reaction and said, "this rarely happens! Let me get another doctor hold on." That doctor said, "I think she's having a reaction because she's so small." To which I said, "do you give the same amount to everyone?" He said YES 😲  I even went to urgent care to have a chest xray and everything came back normal and the doc said it was anxiety but I know what that feels like and this was different. After taking this product for a week, I can finally take deep breaths and I have a lot of energy.

text: I was taking Iodoral and it wasn't going so well. I switched to this after giving it a few days of no iodine. Almost immediately I was sleeping better (the iodine was keeping me awake), was more regular (again, the iodine was making me constipated), the puffiness under my eyes is diminishing, my stomach is flatter, I have lost 3 pounds, I have more energy, and my mood is better. I am always in a good mood, but I think this even kicked me up a notch. Not sure what is in this stuff, but as far as I am concerned, it's a keeper!I am taking 3 capsules daily with water.I've never had such immediate results with ANYTHING. It may seem exaggerated because I felt so bad on the Iodoral, but I really like this product.

text: I've been researching natural supplements to help fight cancer and this supplement was at the top of the list and highly recommended.  I read every review here before I ordered it, unfortunately after I received it I read a review on WebMD about Modifilan that scared me and the bottle has remained unopened.  The person that wrote the review claimed they got Hashimoto's disease from taking Modifilan, she said it was incurable and regretted ever taking the supplement.  Does anyone have any information on this and can allay my fears about giving this supplement to a family member that is fighting cancer?  I have not added it to their protocol for fear of making their health worse but if it will help in any way then I want to add it.

text: I bought this product for help with energy and weight loss. Ive been taking it for about 2 weeks now and this product is the only thing different ive been doing. Amazingly it seems to be helping with....smoking. I usually smoke about 6-7 cigarettes a day and since taking this my urges went way down almost immediately. Im now down to 1-2 cigarettes a day. Nothing ive read says this product helps with smoking but it sure is doing something to help with my urges. Now i think about cigarettes and think nope just dont sound appealing. I Havent lost any weight yet but my appetite is down. Not quite sure about the energy, i do feel more focused though.Update 3/31/2017I don't seem to be benefiting from this at all. I'm not sure if it was a placebo affect that helped with the smoking or not. But it's been a month now and I see no difference in it, after the first week. I'd be willing to try it again just don't really want to spend money on something that shows no results. I'm on a strict low carb diet, I exercise and also take a 5htp supplement. Downgrading my rating from a 4 star to a 3. Sorry but not results. I'm trying to find something that helps with energy level and brain fog. Did not seem to help with that at all. However every body is different.

text: I'v tried it a few times now. The results are are fairly good; I'm am on it now, here is what I feel- Very energetic, I am at work now, but would love to hit the gym.- I feel confident in being outspoken and engaging; even aggressively if need be, in any conversation with anyone regardless of their status.- It seems all the noise around me is toned down, however the noise pitch of people or music is much more intense.- I feel like writing, which I am actually doing writing this.- My anxiety and sense of under achievement is still prevalent, but to a much lesser extent than other days.- I am not hungry, and the thought of eating anything that is not culinary or nutritionally balanced seems discussing.Btw it says on the bottle "For maximum benefits, take 6 capsules in the morning with a full glass of water. Do they mean take them all at once ? has anyone tried that ?

name: KINDERS Creamy Steakhouse, French Onion, Whiskey Apple Buttery Buffalo & Parmesan Herb are Zero Calories, Zero Fat , Vegan & Keto Friendly Kinder Seasoning - [8.7 Oz Each] BETRULIGHT Value Pack of 2 (French Onion)
description: BETRULIGHT Brings to you your Favorate KINDERS Creamy Steakhouse, French Onion, Whiskey Apple Buttery Buffalo & Parmesan Herb are Zero Calories, Zero Fat , Vegan & Keto Friendly Kinder Seasoning - [8.7 Oz Each] BETRULIGHT Value Pack of 2 Kinders Creamy Steakhouse seasoning is all about taking flavor to the next level. They were inspired by the creamy kick of great horseradish-style sauces you can find at amazing steakhouses. Kinders new Whiskey Apple seasoning was inspired by the rich flavor of bourbon whiskey combined with the sweet, tangy flavor of fresh apples It’s not just for soup anymore. Kinder French Onion seasoning was inspired by the amazing, sweet taste of caramelized onions simmered in rich broth It’s about time to shake up your Buffalo game. Kinders Buttery Buffalo seasoning is a combination of spicy cayenne pepper sauce and tangy vinegar for that classic Buffalo flavor you love that is now easier than ever to achieve Kinders new Parmesan Herb Crunch Blend is about to change everything. It’s a blend of garlic, herbs, and real parmesan combined with oil to make it perfect for dipping, topping and seasoning just about anything. We love it on pizza, scrambled eggs and pasta. When mixed with mayo, it makes an awesome sandwich spread. Toss it with pasta for a quick meal
features: Introducing Kinders Creamy Steakhouse Seasoning—elevate flavor to new heights! Crafted from real horseradish, sour cream, cracked pepper, garlic, and spices, it mirrors the creamy kick of top-notch steakhouse sauces. Perfect for steaks, burgers, fish, mashed potatoes, roasted veggies, and beyond. Don't miss the chance to savor its irresistible punch of taste.
Non GMO & Gluten Free
NO Added Artificial Flavors & No Added Preservatives
AWARD-WINNING FLAVORS: A masterful blend of herbs and spices, our Meat Rub is packed with mouthwatering flavors you can’t get enough of
TASTE: You’ll notice the difference in the first bite; our Meat Rub is made with a masterful blend of herbs and spices that is an absolute must for ever BBQ lover
EASY TO USE: If you use this, your food will taste great, and you'll finally grill at the quality you've always wanted
ELEVATES YOUR MEALS: Made for chefs and grill masters alike, our Meat Rub will elevate any meal
GREAT FOR GRILLING: These are great for grilling beef, chicken, fish, pork, and veggies, bagel seasoning and others

text: Every seed purchase I have bought from this company has been great. The quality germination and beauty are phenomenal.I tried to save money by going through dirt goddess for bulk seed calendula even though I have bought mine here great results.It was a mistake. I’m now stuck having to send back seed two times traveling 3 counties to return mislabeled wrong seed. The first time they sent a south East mix the second time corn a pound of dried corn seed labeled Calendula.Trust me don’t shop anywhere else for this seed trying to save money. Stick with what is tried and true. The flowers are beautiful and the germination is fabulous. No, mislabeled wrong products in shipping either.

text: I wasn’t having much luck with seeds this year (I think the birds were eating a lot of it) so I didn’t have high hopes. These started out very straggly and I still didn’t have much hope. But then in the past 2-4 weeks they have finally took off and I’m pleasantly surprised. I’m in Central NY. I planted them mid-June and they started flowering late August/early September. Next year I’ll try to plant in May for earlier blooms.

text: Planted these in a hospital window. With the sun on them they germinated and sprouted within three days. I was so surprised. Literally grow a cm a day it’s mind blowing.Mine need a lot of water, might be because of the sun shining on them all day. And I plant a lot of them… by accident, didn’t think all the seeds would sprout.It’s been over a month and they have not budded yet, though they are looking beautiful and are starting to have a lovely aroma!!Will update!

text: Excellent reading, especially as we are certified organic growers of botanicals, selling them to a distiller and attempting to learn more about herbs as we go.  This was all about the basics, but it did cover scientific names, medicinal, culinary, and cosmetic uses.  Originally I borrowed it from the local library, then realized it was a book we needed in our personal home library.

text: I researched many different alternative ways to help a family member who was shockingly diagnosed with non-hodgkins lymphoma, a blood cancer. (I must say that the power of prayer is first and foremost in my books, but for those who are not religious, put that comment aside please and read on.)I wanted to find products that could help could help clean the blood and boost the body's immune system. I read great things about seaweed and how those exposed to radiation were using it to detox their blood. I also found that it is hard to get "pure" seaweed because much of it is contaminated in the ocean. I trusted this product's web site for the safety of this product and bought the Modifilan. It mentioned that is contains Fucoidan which causes certain types of rapidly growing cancer cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis (self-destruction of cancer cells), Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism.It is expensive, but completely worth it. After only several months of taking this daily along with these other products, which I will list below, the cancer disappeared. It was a truly miracle to all of us and the doctors could not explain it, but I believe that these products greatly helped along with a change in diet (eliminate sugar and eat veggies). The other products that were taken in combination with this were, listed from most important to least taken were: Essiac, IP-6, Source Naturals Immune Defense (mushrooms), liquid chlorophyll, Krill oil,  Purple Defense, Momordica extract, Curcumin. Yes, I know it's a lot and you can never know for sure which one helped the most, but maybe the combination of them all did. I just wanted to list them so that others who might be in a similar situation, who are looking for cancer fighting products, can easily see what may work for them.
title: Great for detox and those with illnesses, such as cancer...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2013
name: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS
description: The powers of seaweeds have been drawn upon for centuries for their ability to prolong life, prevent disease, impart beauty and health. Worldwide research is continuously being done and brown seaweed has been found to be the most beneficial type. This product, MODIFILAN, is the purest, most natural nutritional supplement made from the brown seaweed Laminaria Japonica. Extract contains the life essential properties of Organic Iodine, Alginates, Fucoidan and Laminarin. Worldwide scientific studies and clinical research of these elements showed: *Organic Iodine feeds the Thyroid Gland, which controls metabolism and promotes maturation of the nervous system. Iodine is important for thyroid disorders, wherever underactive or overactive. *Alginate is a natural absorbent of radioactive elements, heavy metals and free radicals. It has the unique ability of binding heavy metals and radioactive elements to its own molecules. As the Alginate cannot be broken down by the bile or saliva and cannot be absorbed by the body, it is secreted from the body together with the heavy metals and radioactive substances. *Fucoidan causes certain types of rapidly growing cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis, Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism. *Laminarin is a polysaccharide helpful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. It exhibits 30% of the anticoagulant activity of heparin. These elements, treasured in brown seaweeds, are enhanced by patented cold-temperature extraction technology, which does not break their molecular structure. And MODIFILAN is not just another dry seaweed product - it is highly concentrated product. FORTY pounds of raw seaweed is needed to make ONE pound of MODIFILAN.

Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium

Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow.

brand: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS

text: I have taken this off and on for years now. I was treated for Lyme disease late 2013 in Scottsdale.  Prior to going to AZ for treatment I had all of my mercury fillings removed and teeth fixed by an awesome dentist. I tested off the charts for both lead and mercury.  While undergoing IV treatment it included some chelation to lower my heavy metals.  By the end of my treatment I was tested again and they were lowered, but still higher than one wants. My Lyme doctor told me when I returned home to Texas I would need to continue chelation therapy. I bought an IV package, but it took 3 months before the home doctor re-tested me for heavy metals before we began chelation therapy.  During those 3 months I took 5-7 Modifilan daily just to help with my energy and I was low on iodine. Shockingly, when my chelation test came back after the 3 months of taking Modifilan my lead and mercury and other heavy metal levels were so low we did not have to do a single chelation treatment!!!  The 3 months of brown seaweed had pulled it out. I had read that it would, but did not know that it would do so efficiently! I always took it first thing in the morning on an empty stomach with a big glass of water due to the iodine. Side benefit it helped my BM's to be smoother and easier to pass.Update: June 8, 2018  I am still taking the Modifilian. When I run out I definitely  notice. Still love it. It still helps with my energy and I am assuming that it is still removing mercury. As your body detoxes heavy metals little by little more will dump from the cells. It is also still helping the bowels move normally.

text: I have been taking this product for only 1 week now but I absolutely feel wonderful. I work in a vitamin store so I have tried a lot of supplements for energy and whatnot but this is by far the best. I had a ct scan about 4 months ago and had a shot of the contrast fluid. I had a "slight" allergic reaction to it including itchy throat, redness on chest and shortness of breath. 4 months later, I'm still short of breath. To my knowledge, this is due to the radiated iodine shot they gave me. The radiologist and GI doc said I would excrete it in my urine but that is definitely false. The radiologist ever freaked out when she saw I had a reaction and said, "this rarely happens! Let me get another doctor hold on." That doctor said, "I think she's having a reaction because she's so small." To which I said, "do you give the same amount to everyone?" He said YES 😲  I even went to urgent care to have a chest xray and everything came back normal and the doc said it was anxiety but I know what that feels like and this was different. After taking this product for a week, I can finally take deep breaths and I have a lot of energy.

text: I was taking Iodoral and it wasn't going so well. I switched to this after giving it a few days of no iodine. Almost immediately I was sleeping better (the iodine was keeping me awake), was more regular (again, the iodine was making me constipated), the puffiness under my eyes is diminishing, my stomach is flatter, I have lost 3 pounds, I have more energy, and my mood is better. I am always in a good mood, but I think this even kicked me up a notch. Not sure what is in this stuff, but as far as I am concerned, it's a keeper!I am taking 3 capsules daily with water.I've never had such immediate results with ANYTHING. It may seem exaggerated because I felt so bad on the Iodoral, but I really like this product.

text: I bought this product for help with energy and weight loss. Ive been taking it for about 2 weeks now and this product is the only thing different ive been doing. Amazingly it seems to be helping with....smoking. I usually smoke about 6-7 cigarettes a day and since taking this my urges went way down almost immediately. Im now down to 1-2 cigarettes a day. Nothing ive read says this product helps with smoking but it sure is doing something to help with my urges. Now i think about cigarettes and think nope just dont sound appealing. I Havent lost any weight yet but my appetite is down. Not quite sure about the energy, i do feel more focused though.Update 3/31/2017I don't seem to be benefiting from this at all. I'm not sure if it was a placebo affect that helped with the smoking or not. But it's been a month now and I see no difference in it, after the first week. I'd be willing to try it again just don't really want to spend money on something that shows no results. I'm on a strict low carb diet, I exercise and also take a 5htp supplement. Downgrading my rating from a 4 star to a 3. Sorry but not results. I'm trying to find something that helps with energy level and brain fog. Did not seem to help with that at all. However every body is different.
title: I bought this product for help with energy and weight ...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
name: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS
description: The powers of seaweeds have been drawn upon for centuries for their ability to prolong life, prevent disease, impart beauty and health. Worldwide research is continuously being done and brown seaweed has been found to be the most beneficial type. This product, MODIFILAN, is the purest, most natural nutritional supplement made from the brown seaweed Laminaria Japonica. Extract contains the life essential properties of Organic Iodine, Alginates, Fucoidan and Laminarin. Worldwide scientific studies and clinical research of these elements showed: *Organic Iodine feeds the Thyroid Gland, which controls metabolism and promotes maturation of the nervous system. Iodine is important for thyroid disorders, wherever underactive or overactive. *Alginate is a natural absorbent of radioactive elements, heavy metals and free radicals. It has the unique ability of binding heavy metals and radioactive elements to its own molecules. As the Alginate cannot be broken down by the bile or saliva and cannot be absorbed by the body, it is secreted from the body together with the heavy metals and radioactive substances. *Fucoidan causes certain types of rapidly growing cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis, Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism. *Laminarin is a polysaccharide helpful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. It exhibits 30% of the anticoagulant activity of heparin. These elements, treasured in brown seaweeds, are enhanced by patented cold-temperature extraction technology, which does not break their molecular structure. And MODIFILAN is not just another dry seaweed product - it is highly concentrated product. FORTY pounds of raw seaweed is needed to make ONE pound of MODIFILAN.
features: Boosts the immune system.
Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium
Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract.
Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow.
Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
brand: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS

text: I'v tried it a few times now. The results are are fairly good; I'm am on it now, here is what I feel- Very energetic, I am at work now, but would love to hit the gym.- I feel confident in being outspoken and engaging; even aggressively if need be, in any conversation with anyone regardless of their status.- It seems all the noise around me is toned down, however the noise pitch of people or music is much more intense.- I feel like writing, which I am actually doing writing this.- My anxiety and sense of under achievement is still prevalent, but to a much lesser extent than other days.- I am not hungry, and the thought of eating anything that is not culinary or nutritionally balanced seems discussing.Btw it says on the bottle "For maximum benefits, take 6 capsules in the morning with a full glass of water. Do they mean take them all at once ? has anyone tried that ?

description: BETRULIGHT Brings to you your Favorate KINDERS Creamy Steakhouse, French Onion, Whiskey Apple Buttery Buffalo & Parmesan Herb are Zero Calories, Zero Fat , Vegan & Keto Friendly Kinder Seasoning - [8.7 Oz Each] BETRULIGHT Value Pack of 2 Kinders Creamy Steakhouse seasoning is all about taking flavor to the next level. They were inspired by the creamy kick of great horseradish-style sauces you can find at amazing steakhouses. Kinders new Whiskey Apple seasoning was inspired by the rich flavor of bourbon whiskey combined with the sweet, tangy flavor of fresh apples It’s not just for soup anymore. Kinder French Onion seasoning was inspired by the amazing, sweet taste of caramelized onions simmered in rich broth It’s about time to shake up your Buffalo game. Kinders Buttery Buffalo seasoning is a combination of spicy cayenne pepper sauce and tangy vinegar for that classic Buffalo flavor you love that is now easier than ever to achieve Kinders new Parmesan Herb Crunch Blend is about to change everything. It’s a blend of garlic, herbs, and real parmesan combined with oil to make it perfect for dipping, topping and seasoning just about anything. We love it on pizza, scrambled eggs and pasta. When mixed with mayo, it makes an awesome sandwich spread. Toss it with pasta for a quick meal
features: Introducing Kinders Creamy Steakhouse Seasoning—elevate flavor to new heights! Perfect for steaks, burgers, fish, mashed potatoes, roasted veggies, and beyond. Don't miss the chance to savor its irresistible punch of taste.

We don't get much help from a county extension office.

title: Love this broth
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024
name: Pacific Foods Beef Broth, 32 oz (Pack of 12)
description: Experience layers of nourishing flavor with Pacific Foods Beef Broth. We slow-simmer beef with garlic and sea salt for a savory beef broth that's rich and full of flavor. Sip a cup of warm beef broth instead of coffee or tea for a delicious, satisfying addition to your everyday routine. It's great for refueling after workouts, beating the afternoon doldrums or relaxing in the evening. Just pour, heat and enjoy! For an even better sipping experience, add a slice of lemon, ginger or some fresh herbs to your gluten free broth. Each 1-cup serving of Pacific Foods Broth contains less than 1 gram of carbs and 20 calories. One 32 oz recyclable carton contains roughly 4 servings. In addition to drinking it as a traditional sipping broth, you can use this broth in any recipe that calls for beef stock, broth or water, such as homemade soups. Try it as a soup base or to cook grains, potatoes and veggies. Pacific Foods also offers unsalted chicken broth and vegetable broth. At Pacific Foods, we're dedicated to making the most nourishing foods possible from simple, carefully sourced ingredients.
features: Slow simmered broth captures the full meaty flavor of beef that is seasoned with garlic and sea salt
Use as a base for soups, risottos and pasta dishes
Fat-free and gluten-free, high quality ingredients
Convenient resealable, twist open carton
Refrigerate after opening and use within 7 to 10 days
Keto Friendly
brand: Pacific Foods

text: It's Beef Broth and yes there's a difference. Some Beef Broth is really a vege broth with beef and no so much of beef at all. This broth ticks all the boxes, I use it instead of water for ramen and or Asian noodle meals, also Mexican ramen. They taste much better and you can choose if you want to add the "spice" powder or not which is mainly hot chili powder and sodium, you can add your own chili sauce, skip the sodium and have a much better meal. I've bought organic Beef Bone Broth but it's a waste of money, costs twice as much as this broth and isn't as beefy. So I say give this broth a try, be sure of what you're buying since this brand also makes a "beef broth" that is the same as I mentioned above, I want beef and nothing but the beef.
